oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Free Hill: A sound portrait of a rural African American community
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Finding Community
Schools
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Front and back cover of the LP, Free Hill-Sound Portrait of an African American Community.

The Free Hill community was established by freed slaves in the years before the Civil War. This LP was created by the Tennessee Folklore Society to document the "oral history and verbal and musical traditions" of the Free Hill Community.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Center for Popular Music, Middle Tennessee State University
